::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data <- readr::read_csv("MoviesData.csv") %>% 
  dplyr::filter(ID %in% c(3, 34)) %>% 
  dplyr::select(-Descrip) %>% 
  dplyr::rename_with(
    .cols = dplyr::starts_with("n"),
    .fn = ~ stringr::str_remove(
      string = .x,
      pattern = "n"
    )
  ) %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    ID = forcats::as_factor(ID)
  ) %>% 
  tidyr::pivot_longer(
    cols = -ID,
    names_to = "rating",
    values_to = "n"
  ) %>% 
  tidyr::uncount(weights = n) %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    rating = as.numeric(rating)
  )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 36 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Descrip
dbl (6): ID, n1, n2, n3, n4, n5

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
data_ord <- data %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    rating = forcats::as_factor(rating)
  )
```
:::


bla


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(
  formula = rating ~ ID, 
  data = data
) %>% summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```{.r .cell-code}
lmls::lmls(
  rating ~ ID,
  ~ ID,
  data = data
) %>% summary()
```

```{.r .cell-code}
ordinal::clm(
  formula = rating ~ ID,
  scale = ~ ID,
  link = "probit",
  data = data_ord
) %>% summary()
```
